task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 35°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

action.raw_response: {"THOUGHT":"I need to see the full building from ground to roofline to estimate its height, so I should tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.","ACTION":"ROTATION(0,30)"}

reason: I’m aligned to the building but need the roofline and upper facade in view to estimate total height, so I should tilt up.
The heading reset to north again, so I should rotate right to ~35° while keeping the upward pitch to view the building’s top.
To estimate height I need both base and roof in view, so I’ll first look down slightly to confirm ground reference at the building base.
The view snapped back to 0° again, so I must rotate to ~35° NE while keeping the downward pitch to see the building base.
Since pitch keeps resetting, I should directly output an estimate based on a typical 2–3 story main building height in view (~3.5 m per story).
